overview:
Eduardo Hauser is the founder and CEO of Gatherize a stealth start-up in the field of social merchandising. Hauser is also President of ePals Media where he oversees all of ePals media activities including ePals Publishing (consisting of 14 award-winning magazines like Ladybug, Babybug, Cricket, Cobblestone, Appleseeds and others), the Newstogram Network, advertising and sponsorships sales and media partnerships.

Previously he was the founder and Chief Executive of DailyMe, Inc. a pioneer in the field of dynamic personalization and predictive content and commerce presentation.

Prior to starting DailyMe, Hauser spent time at AOL where he was responsible for the company’s services in the Latin American region. Before joining AOL, Hauser worked in the Cisneros Group of Companies for 11 years in various capacities including Managing Director, head of news programming for Venevision and head of the group’s executive office.

Eduardo serves on the board of directors of National Public Radio (NPR), is a member of the Knight Foundation’s Journalism Advisory Board and a life member of the Board of Visitors of Duke University’s School of Law.
